message.body: Afghanistan: "U.S. government made “gesture of sympathy” payments of $3,000 to each injured person and $6,000 to each family of the killed.", 16 "military members were given administrative punishments that could stall or end careers, but no one faces a court martial. A senior defense official said one of the disciplined was a 2-star general." http://www.pbs.org/newshour/rundown/punishments-but-no-criminal-charges-in-u-s-attack-on-hospital/

I will tell you how .bit resolving here works, since I am not sure actually what you really want
ZeroNet sites query ZeroName for the address of the .bit
you can also set up your own zeroname (if you think zeroname is untrustable), your own zeroname can also run your own namecoind
so, if you want to add functionality to this, you can add code to ZeroName
are you still with me, @teszt@zid ? anything what I said fits into your world-domination plans ? :-)
ZeroName does resolving of domain
the problem is: 1. I had no coffee yet, 2. I had less sleep.
I am not sure what you want
useful: it depends
1. when you make too tight integration, all ZN users must have also the namecoin blockchain, and that is huge, and takes time to download/sync
2. thus when you want to avoid 1. you have to trsut someone doing that job for you
and you know how it is with trust
a guy that has control over domains, can be e.g. hacked so stuff gets redirected somewhere else
huge namecoin blockchain: the main dev Jeremy wrote once to make a lightweight version, but it is only talk for now
btw @teszt@zid about "haha, sorry for disturbing" <- you are not, questions are always good
yes, Jeremy is a capable guy, not only interested in his NMC, but discussing various things: politics, technology
you mean ignore everything from: "here ... purpose" ?
otherwsie I would have responded: if they can sync from ZN, why not sync directly from Namecoin itself ?
you wrote: "forget the ?", and I assume you were referring to your sentence which started with "here..."
so, to answer your question 2: I wouldn't like doing that:
better would be, users make their own zeroname and can query with their own namecoin daemon the domains
no need to waste tracker's bandwidth with "redundant namecoin blocks"
but in general: your question 2 would be doable, yes
adds never will work, every browser has easy access to ad blockers
right, ad-people could host their stuff also here
why would I - as normal user - want to have to do anything involving namecoin ? namecoin is a beast I don't want to know about. I just want to visit my (home)pages
and about ads: no one actually wants them. It might work at begin, but sooner or later someone will make a blocker (also for ZN ad sites)
what people coudl pay for: increased security, valuing people's work by helping others, ...
as info: @nofish had on his roadmap a marketplace
